list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Introduce standard platform implementation for signal and utility functions
- Added `src/platform/starforth_standard.c` for platform abstraction. - Implemented standard functions like `sf_exit`, `sf_sleep`, `sf_sigaction`, and `sf_itoa`. - Provided POSIX and non-POSIX compatible implementations for signal handling. - Ensured compatibility with FORTH-79 Standard and ANSI C99.

task.summary:
Refactor to use platform abstraction for memory operations and type definitions
- Replaced standard library calls (`memset`, `memcpy`, etc.) with platform-specific wrappers (`sf_memset`, `sf_memcpy`, etc.). - Consolidated type definitions and removed system headers in favor of `starforth_platform.h`. - Simplified logging and IO setup by eliminating dependency on standard headers like `string.h` and `stdarg.h`. - Streamlined VM memory initialization using platform abstractions.

Introduce standard platform implementation for signal and utility functions

MESSAGE.value:
Refactor to use platform abstraction for memory operations and type definitions
- Replaced standard library calls (`memset`, `memcpy`, etc.) with platform-specific wrappers (`sf_memset`, `sf_memcpy`, etc.). - Consolidated type definitions and removed system headers in favor of `starforth_platform.h`. - Simplified logging and IO setup by eliminating dependency on standard headers like `string.h` and `stdarg.h`. - Streamlined VM memory initialization using platform abstractions.

Introduce `starforth_standard.c` for FORTH-79 and ANSI C99 platform standardization
- Added `starforth_standard.c` with platform abstraction implementations for signal handling, timing, and utility functions. - Implemented `sf_itoa` for custom integer-to-string conversion as `itoa` is non-standard. - Ensured cross-platform compatibility with conditional handling for POSIX and non-POSIX systems.

Introduce standard platform implementation for signal and utility functions
- Added `src/platform/starforth_standard.c` for platform abstraction. - Implemented standard functions like `sf_exit`, `sf_sleep`, `sf_sigaction`, and `sf_itoa`. - Provided POSIX and non-POSIX compatible implementations for signal handling. - Ensured compatibility with FORTH-79 Standard and ANSI C99.
